name: corrugation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a line or fold on the surface of something: The path is full of corrugations which make it unsuitable for caravans. On this scan, you can see the normal corrugations of the brain surface.
[ U ] the fact of having small lines or folds on a surface: I moved a finger across the surface but could not detect any corrugation. The manufacturers use corrugation to keep the bottles strong despite the thinness of the glass.
More examplesFewer examplesThe surface of the planet has many sharp corrugations.The whole van shook as we went over the potholes and corrugations.To get to the farm we had to go down a track with many ruts and corrugations. The track had a series of corrugations running across it at right angles.
